I am 41 years old.  I have three kids (your,mine and ours), thier ages are 19,14,6. In Aug of 08 We found out that my husband had a brain Tumor. He went through surgery, chemo and Rad. but it didn't do him any good, He died in Nov of 08. So to tell you that I was scared when I found out that I had BC is an understatement. I was so worried who would take care of my 6 yr old.  But my dr. all of them kept telling me that this is different. That this is cureable and what he had was not.  So im going to fight with all I have. I just want to know if any of you are wearing a wig. Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2011 06:53PM 1Miclon wrote: TAC x6 every 3weeks just had rd2 on thr. It seems I'm the only one on this treament plan. I think we all have the same meds but in different plans. Mine is texotere, adriamycin and cytoxan. I'm not really having any SE which is good. I usually have to take a nap on sat. I also have the neulasta shot the next day. Am I the only one who thinks that shot hurts. Its funny I always tell my kids oh it want hurt but I will not say that any more. My hair started coming out Feb 1 and by sunday I had to cut it. My aunt came to shave me but she said it would be easier if I just she just buzzed it. I blow dry my hair after I wash it to get the lose hairs off and that helps with the ichy head. Also for dry skin I found that Oil of  Olay body wash the 4 in 1 kind. I wear my wig out I just can't go out without it ( not ready). I do go commando in the house even when i sleep. Thank for all the welcome comments and the sympathy for my DH.
